src:
Ups! Politikus Ukraina Ketahuan Chatting dengan PSK Saat Rapat Parlemen
01 Nov 2019, 13:50 by Novi Christiastuti
Kiev - Seorang anggota parlemen Ukraina terjepret kamera wartawan sedang chatting di telepon genggamnya, dengan seorang pekerja seks komersial (PSK), saat sidang di gedung parlemen. Atas hal ini, sang anggota parlemen pun meminta maaf ke publik.
Seperti dilansir BBC, Jumat (1/11/2019), anggota parlemen bernama Bohdan Yaremenko ini diketahui sudah menikah dan memiliki dua anak. Dia juga diketahui menjabat sebagai Ketua Komisi Hubungan Luar Negeri pada parlemen Ukraina.
Jepretan kamera seorang wartawan foto menunjukkan Yaremenko sedang membuka situs Buvky untuk membahas layanan seks dan harganya.
Dalam foto lainnya, Yaremenko terjepret kamera sedang melihat-lihat profil pada aplikasi kencan Tinder di telepon genggamnya.
Mengetahui aktivitasnya saat rapat parlemen dibongkar media, Yaremenko awalnya membela perilakunya dalam pernyataan via Facebook. Dia menyebut perilakunya itu sebagai 'provokasi disengaja' yang dilakukannya untuk mempermalukan wartawan-wartawan yang gemar 'mengintip'.
Diketahui bahwa bukan hal yang langka bagi wartawan-wartawan Ukraina untuk mengungkap chat pribadi para politikus saat menghadiri rapat-rapat parlemen.
text:
Oops! Ukrainian politician caught chatting with prostitutes during parliamentary meetings
Nov 01 2019, 13:50 by Novi Christiastuti
Kiev - A member of the Ukrainian parliament was photographed by a reporter camera while chatting on his cellphone, with a commercial sex worker (CSW), during a hearing at the parliament building. For this, the MPs apologized to the public.
As reported by the BBC, Friday (11/01/2019), a member of parliament named Bohdan Yaremenko is known to be married and has two children. He is also known to have served as Chair of the Foreign Relations Commission in the Ukrainian parliament.
A photojournalist's camera shot shows Yaremenko opening the Buvky website to discuss sex services and their prices.
In another photo, Yaremenko was shot by a camera looking at profiles on the Tinder dating app on his cellphone.
Knowing his activities when the parliamentary meeting was dismantled by the media, Yaremenko initially defended his behavior in a statement via Facebook. He called his behavior a "deliberate provocation" which he did to embarrass journalists who liked to "peek".
It is known that it is not uncommon for Ukrainian journalists to uncover the private chats of politicians while attending parliamentary meetings.
